title: Probably an obvious condensed Sans Serif! I think the O is not part of the font.
content:
I am after the exact font used for the cover of:  
STOP TALKING START DOING (see graphic)  
Reason being I am designing the next one in the series and the publisher doesn't know the font.  
Help with this would be much appreciated.

Font: 

 Knockout HTF28-JuniorFeatherwt 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052332/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [stop talking.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052332/http:/typophile.com/files/stop%20talking.jpg) | 39.08 KB |
author: Rawshock Design

comments.content:
Is that all it is! No wonder no one answered. It looked somehow more rounded?!  
That was the font I was working with in any case (as a stand in) until I found out from someone what it was.  
Doh!  
Thank you by the way :)

Is that all it is! No wonder no one answered. It looked somehow more rounded?!  
That was the font I was working with in any case (as a stand in) until I found out from someone what it was.  
Doh!  
Thank you by the way :)
Have a look to [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317052332/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/knockout/overview), that should be one of this numerous family (something like No.48 Featherweight).

ah yes, could also be one of the fonts in the knockout family. I will also check this font for comparison.  
Thanks ;)
Ryuk is correct, Knockout also looks close for this
Actually, can't be Trade Gothic, /R leg does not fit your sample at all. Knockout should be...
Knockout is the correct font. Thank you all.
